precontext: She wandered through the busy market. Stalls lined the street, filled with colorful sights and sounds. Her gaze drifted, catching various things and people.
sentence: That peach over there is grabbing her attention.
ending: It looked so juicy and fresh that she wanted to go and buy it.
meanings_considered: downy juicy fruit with sweet yellowish or whitish flesh
a very attractive or seductive looking woman
explanation:
• The precontext describes a market scene with colorful stalls and fresh sights, making the fruit meaning highly plausible and contextually grounded.  
• The phrase "That peach over there is grabbing her attention" uses "peach" in a way that aligns with the fruit meaning, as attention is drawn to a visually appealing, fresh product.  
• The ending explicitly refers to the fruit as "juicy and fresh," which strongly confirms the fruit meaning and directly contradicts the woman-as-attraction interpretation.
